43class ObjectRef;
44
45std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, ObjectRef ref);
46
47#define TRACE_BROKER(broker, x) \
48 do { \
49 if (broker->tracing_enabled() && v8_flags.trace_heap_broker_verbose) \
50 StdoutStream{} << broker->Trace() << x << '\n'; \
51 } while (false)
52
53#define TRACE_BROKER_MEMORY(broker, x) \
54 do { \
55 if (broker->tracing_enabled() && v8_flags.trace_heap_broker_memory) \
56 StdoutStream{} << broker->Trace() << x << std::endl; \
57 } while (false)
58
59#define TRACE_BROKER_MISSING(broker, x) \
60 do { \
61 if (broker->tracing_enabled()) \
62 StdoutStream{} << broker->Trace() << "Missing " << x << " (" << __FILE__ \
63 << ":" << __LINE__ << ")" << std::endl; \
64 } while (false)
65
66struct PropertyAccessTarget {
67 MapRef map;
68 NameRef name;
69 AccessMode mode;
70
71 struct Hash {
72 size_t operator()(const PropertyAccessTarget& pair) const {
73 return base::hash_combine(
74 base::hash_combine(pair.map.object().address(),
75 pair.name.object().address()),
76 static_cast<int>(pair.mode));
77 }
78 };
79 struct Equal {
80 bool operator()(const PropertyAccessTarget& lhs,
81 const PropertyAccessTarget& rhs) const {
82 return lhs.map.equals(rhs.map) && lhs.name.equals(rhs.name) &&
83 lhs.mode == rhs.mode;
84 }
85 };
86};
87
88enum GetOrCreateDataFlag {
89 // If set, a failure to create the data object results in a crash.
90 kCrashOnError = 1 << 0,
91 // If set, data construction assumes that the given object is protected by
92 // a memory fence (e.g. acquire-release) and thus fields required for
93 // construction (like Object::map) are safe to read. The protection can
94 // extend to some other situations as well.
95 kAssumeMemoryFence = 1 << 1,
96};
97using GetOrCreateDataFlags = base::Flags<GetOrCreateDataFlag>;
98DEFINE_OPERATORS_FOR_FLAGS(GetOrCreateDataFlags)
99
100class V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE JSHeapBroker {
101 public:
102 JSHeapBroker(Isolate* isolate, Zone* broker_zone, bool tracing_enabled,
103 CodeKind code_kind);
104
105 // For use only in tests, sets default values for some arguments. Avoids
106 // churn when new flags are added.
107 JSHeapBroker(Isolate* isolate, Zone* broker_zone)
108 : JSHeapBroker(isolate, broker_zone, v8_flags.trace_heap_broker,
109 CodeKind::TURBOFAN) {}
110
111 ~JSHeapBroker();
112
113 // The compilation target's native context. We need the setter because at
114 // broker construction time we don't yet have the canonical handle.
115 NativeContextRef target_native_context() const {
116 return target_native_context_.value();
117 }
118 void SetTargetNativeContextRef(Handle<NativeContext> native_context);
119
120 void InitializeAndStartSerializing(Handle<NativeContext> native_context);
121
122 Isolate* isolate() const { return isolate_; }
123
124 // The pointer compression cage base value used for decompression of all
125 // tagged values except references to InstructionStream objects.
126 PtrComprCageBase cage_base() const {
127#if V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS
128 return cage_base_;
129#else
130 return PtrComprCageBase{};
131#endif // V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS
132 }
133
134 Zone* zone() const { return zone_; }
135 bool tracing_enabled() const { return tracing_enabled_; }
136
137 NexusConfig feedback_nexus_config() const {
138 return IsMainThread() ? NexusConfig::FromMainThread(isolate())
139 : NexusConfig::FromBackgroundThread(
140 isolate(), local_isolate()->heap());
141 }

155 // Remember the local isolate and initialize its local heap with the
156 // persistent and canonical handles provided by {info}.

160 // handles provided back to {info}. {info} is responsible for disposing of

252 bool IsMainThread() const {
253 return local_isolate() == nullptr || local_isolate()->is_main_thread();
254 }
255
256 LocalIsolate* local_isolate() const { return local_isolate_; }
257
258 // TODO(jgruber): Consider always having local_isolate_ set to a real value.
259 // This seems not entirely trivial since we currently reset local_isolate_ to
260 // nullptr at some point in the JSHeapBroker lifecycle.
261 LocalIsolate* local_isolate_or_isolate() const {
262 return local_isolate() != nullptr ? local_isolate()
263 : isolate()->AsLocalIsolate();
264 }
265
266 base::Optional<RootIndex> FindRootIndex(HeapObjectRef object) {
267 // No root constant is a JSReceiver.
268 if (object.IsJSReceiver()) return {};
269 Address address = object.object()->ptr();
270 RootIndex root_index;
271 if (root_index_map_.Lookup(address, &root_index)) {
272 return root_index;
273 }
274 return {};
275 }
276
277 // Return the corresponding canonical persistent handle for {object}. Create
278 // one if it does not exist.
279 // If a local isolate is attached, we can create the persistent handle through
280 // it. This commonly happens during the Execute phase.
281 // If we don't, that means we are calling this method from serialization. If
282 // that happens, we should be inside a persistent handle scope. Then, we would
283 // just use the regular handle creation.
284 template <typename T>
285 Handle<T> CanonicalPersistentHandle(Tagged<T> object) {
286 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(canonical_handles_);
287 Address address = object.ptr();
288 if (Internals::HasHeapObjectTag(address)) {
289 RootIndex root_index;
290 // CollectArrayAndObjectPrototypes calls this function often with T equal
291 // to JSObject. The root index map only contains immortal, immutable
292 // objects; it never contains any instances of type JSObject, since
293 // JSObjects must exist within a NativeContext, and NativeContexts can be
294 // created and destroyed. Thus, we can skip the lookup in the root index
295 // map for those values and save a little time.
296 if constexpr (std::is_convertible_v<T, JSObject>) {
297 DCHECK(!root_index_map_.Lookup(address, &root_index));
298 } else if (root_index_map_.Lookup(address, &root_index)) {
299 return Handle<T>(isolate_->root_handle(root_index).location());
300 }
301 }
302
303 Tagged<Object> obj(address);
304 auto find_result = canonical_handles_->FindOrInsert(obj);
305 if (find_result.already_exists) return Handle<T>(*find_result.entry);
306
307 // Allocate new PersistentHandle if one wasn't created before.
308 if (local_isolate()) {
309 *find_result.entry =
310 local_isolate()->heap()->NewPersistentHandle(obj).location();
311 } else {
312 DCHECK(PersistentHandlesScope::IsActive(isolate()));
313 *find_result.entry = Handle<T>(object, isolate()).location();
314 }
315 return Handle<T>(*find_result.entry);
316 }
317
318 template <typename T>
319 Handle<T> CanonicalPersistentHandle(Handle<T> object) {
320 if (object.is_null()) return object; // Can't deref a null handle.
321 return CanonicalPersistentHandle<T>(*object);
322 }
323
324 // Checks if a canonical persistent handle for {object} exists.
325 template <typename T>
326 bool IsCanonicalHandle(Handle<T> handle) {
327 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(canonical_handles_);
328 Address* location = handle.location();
329 Address address = *location;
330 if (Internals::HasHeapObjectTag(address)) {
331 RootIndex root_index;
332 if (root_index_map_.Lookup(address, &root_index)) {
333 return true;
334 }
335 // Builtins use pseudo handles that are canonical and persistent by
336 // design.
337 if (isolate()->IsBuiltinTableHandleLocation(location)) {
338 return true;
339 }
340 }
341 return canonical_handles_->Find(Tagged<Object>(address)) != nullptr;
342 }
343
344 std::string Trace() const;
345 void IncrementTracingIndentation();
346 void DecrementTracingIndentation();
347
348 // Locks {mutex} through the duration of this scope iff it is the first
349 // occurrence. This is done to have a recursive shared lock on {mutex}.
350 class V8_NODISCARD RecursiveSharedMutexGuardIfNeeded {
351 protected:
352 V8_INLINE RecursiveSharedMutexGuardIfNeeded(LocalIsolate* local_isolate,
353 base::SharedMutex* mutex,
354 int* mutex_depth_address);
355
356 ~RecursiveSharedMutexGuardIfNeeded() {
357 DCHECK_GE((*mutex_depth_address_), 1);
358 (*mutex_depth_address_)--;
359 DCHECK_EQ(initial_mutex_depth_, (*mutex_depth_address_));
360 }
361
362 private:
363 int* const mutex_depth_address_;
364 const int initial_mutex_depth_;
365 ParkedSharedMutexGuardIf<base::kShared> shared_mutex_guard_;
366 };
367
368 class MapUpdaterGuardIfNeeded final
369 : public RecursiveSharedMutexGuardIfNeeded {
370 public:
371 V8_INLINE explicit MapUpdaterGuardIfNeeded(JSHeapBroker* broker);
372 };
373
374 class BoilerplateMigrationGuardIfNeeded final
375 : public RecursiveSharedMutexGuardIfNeeded {
376 public:
377 V8_INLINE explicit BoilerplateMigrationGuardIfNeeded(JSHeapBroker* broker);
378 };

380 // If this returns false, the object is guaranteed to be fully initialized and
381 // thus safe to read from a memory safety perspective. The converse does not
382 // necessarily hold.
383 bool ObjectMayBeUninitialized(Handle<Object> object) const;
384 bool ObjectMayBeUninitialized(Tagged<Object> object) const;
385 bool ObjectMayBeUninitialized(Tagged<HeapObject> object) const;
386
387 void set_dependencies(CompilationDependencies* dependencies) {
388 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(dependencies);
389 DCHECK_NULL(dependencies_);
390 dependencies_ = dependencies;
391 }
392 CompilationDependencies* dependencies() const {
393 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(dependencies_);
394 return dependencies_;
395 }

436 void set_persistent_handles(
437 std::unique_ptr<PersistentHandles> persistent_handles) {
438 DCHECK_NULL(ph_);
439 ph_ = std::move(persistent_handles);
440 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(ph_);
441 }
442 std::unique_ptr<PersistentHandles> DetachPersistentHandles() {
443 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(ph_);
444 return std::move(ph_);
445 }

448 canonical_handles_ = canonical_handles;
449 }

451#define V(Type, name, Name) void Init##Name();
452 READ_ONLY_ROOT_LIST(V)
453#undef V
454
455 Isolate* const isolate_;
456#if V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS
457 const PtrComprCageBase cage_base_;
458#endif // V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS
459 Zone* const zone_;
460 OptionalNativeContextRef target_native_context_;
461 RefsMap* refs_;
462 RootIndexMap root_index_map_;
463 ZoneUnorderedSet<Handle<JSObject>, Handle<JSObject>::hash,
464 Handle<JSObject>::equal_to>
465 array_and_object_prototypes_;
466 BrokerMode mode_ = kDisabled;
467 bool const tracing_enabled_;
468 CodeKind const code_kind_;
469 std::unique_ptr<PersistentHandles> ph_;
470 LocalIsolate* local_isolate_ = nullptr;
471 // The CanonicalHandlesMap is owned by the compilation info.
472 CanonicalHandlesMap* canonical_handles_;
473 unsigned trace_indentation_ = 0;
474 ZoneUnorderedMap<FeedbackSource, ProcessedFeedback const*,
475 FeedbackSource::Hash, FeedbackSource::Equal>
476 feedback_;
477 ZoneUnorderedMap<PropertyAccessTarget, PropertyAccessInfo,
478 PropertyAccessTarget::Hash, PropertyAccessTarget::Equal>
479 property_access_infos_;
480
481 // Cache read only roots to avoid needing to look them up via the map.
482#define V(Type, name, Name) \
483 OptionalRef<typename ref_traits<Type>::ref_type> name##_;
484 READ_ONLY_ROOT_LIST(V)
485#undef V
486
487 CompilationDependencies* dependencies_ = nullptr;
488
489 // The MapUpdater mutex is used in recursive patterns; for example,
490 // ComputePropertyAccessInfo may call itself recursively. Thus we need to
491 // emulate a recursive mutex, which we do by checking if this heap broker
492 // instance already holds the mutex when a lock is requested. This field
493 // holds the locking depth, i.e. how many times the mutex has been
494 // recursively locked. Only the outermost locker actually locks underneath.
495 int map_updater_mutex_depth_ = 0;
496 // Likewise for boilerplate migrations.
497 int boilerplate_migration_mutex_depth_ = 0;
498
499 static constexpr uint32_t kMinimalRefsBucketCount = 8;
500 static_assert(base::bits::IsPowerOfTwo(kMinimalRefsBucketCount));
501 static constexpr uint32_t kInitialRefsBucketCount = 1024;
502 static_assert(base::bits::IsPowerOfTwo(kInitialRefsBucketCount));
503};

505#ifdef DEBUG
506// In debug builds, store the current heap broker on a thread local, for
507// DCHECKs to access it via JSHeapBroker::Current();
508class V8_NODISCARD V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE CurrentHeapBrokerScope {
509 public:
510 explicit CurrentHeapBrokerScope(JSHeapBroker* broker);
511 ~CurrentHeapBrokerScope();
512
513 private:
514 JSHeapBroker* const prev_broker_;
515};
516#else
517class V8_NODISCARD V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE CurrentHeapBrokerScope {
518 public:

520 ~CurrentHeapBrokerScope() {}
521};
522#endif

524class V8_NODISCARD TraceScope {
525 public:
526 TraceScope(JSHeapBroker* broker, const char* label)
527 : TraceScope(broker, static_cast<void*>(broker), label) {}
528
529 TraceScope(JSHeapBroker* broker, ObjectData* data, const char* label)
530 : TraceScope(broker, static_cast<void*>(data), label) {}
531
532 TraceScope(JSHeapBroker* broker, void* subject, const char* label)
533 : broker_(broker) {
534 TRACE_BROKER(broker_, "Running " << label << " on " << subject);
535 broker_->IncrementTracingIndentation();
536 }
537
538 ~TraceScope() { broker_->DecrementTracingIndentation(); }
539
540 private:
541 JSHeapBroker* const broker_;
542};
543
544// Scope that unparks the LocalHeap, if:
545// a) We have a JSHeapBroker,
546// b) Said JSHeapBroker has a LocalIsolate and thus a LocalHeap,
547// c) Said LocalHeap has been parked and
548// d) The given condition evaluates to true.
549// Used, for example, when printing the graph with --trace-turbo with a
550// previously parked LocalHeap.
551class V8_NODISCARD UnparkedScopeIfNeeded {
552 public:
553 explicit UnparkedScopeIfNeeded(JSHeapBroker* broker,
554 bool extra_condition = true) {
555 if (broker != nullptr && extra_condition) {
556 LocalIsolate* local_isolate = broker->local_isolate();
557 if (local_isolate != nullptr && local_isolate->heap()->IsParked()) {
558 unparked_scope.emplace(local_isolate->heap());
559 }
560 }
561 }
562
563 private:
564 base::Optional<UnparkedScope> unparked_scope;
565};
566
567class V8_NODISCARD JSHeapBrokerScopeForTesting {
568 public:
569 JSHeapBrokerScopeForTesting(JSHeapBroker* broker, Isolate* isolate,
570 Zone* zone)
571 : JSHeapBrokerScopeForTesting(
572 broker, std::make_unique<CanonicalHandlesMap>(
573 isolate->heap(), ZoneAllocationPolicy(zone))) {}
574 JSHeapBrokerScopeForTesting(
575 JSHeapBroker* broker,
576 std::unique_ptr<CanonicalHandlesMap> canonical_handles)
577 : canonical_handles_(std::move(canonical_handles)), broker_(broker) {
578 broker_->set_canonical_handles(canonical_handles_.get());
579 }
580 ~JSHeapBrokerScopeForTesting() { broker_->set_canonical_handles(nullptr); }
581
582 private:
583 std::unique_ptr<CanonicalHandlesMap> canonical_handles_;
584 JSHeapBroker* const broker_;
585};
586
587template <class T, typename = std::enable_if_t<is_subtype_v<T, Object>>>
588OptionalRef<typename ref_traits<T>::ref_type> TryMakeRef(JSHeapBroker* broker,
589 ObjectData* data) {
590 if (data == nullptr) return {};
591 return {typename ref_traits<T>::ref_type(data)};
592}
593
594// Usage:
595//
596// OptionalFooRef ref = TryMakeRef(broker, o);
597// if (!ref.has_value()) return {}; // bailout
598//
599// or
600//
601// FooRef ref = MakeRef(broker, o);
602template <class T, typename = std::enable_if_t<is_subtype_v<T, Object>>>
603OptionalRef<typename ref_traits<T>::ref_type> TryMakeRef(
604 JSHeapBroker* broker, Tagged<T> object, GetOrCreateDataFlags flags = {}) {
605 ObjectData* data = broker->TryGetOrCreateData(object, flags);
606 if (data == nullptr) {
607 TRACE_BROKER_MISSING(broker, "ObjectData for " << Brief(object));
608 }
609 return TryMakeRef<T>(broker, data);
610}
611
612template <class T, typename = std::enable_if_t<is_subtype_v<T, Object>>>
613OptionalRef<typename ref_traits<T>::ref_type> TryMakeRef(
614 JSHeapBroker* broker, T object, GetOrCreateDataFlags flags = {}) {
615 static_assert(kTaggedCanConvertToRawObjects);
616 return TryMakeRef<T>(broker, Tagged<T>(object), flags);
617}
618
619template <class T, typename = std::enable_if_t<is_subtype_v<T, Object>>>
620OptionalRef<typename ref_traits<T>::ref_type> TryMakeRef(
621 JSHeapBroker* broker, Handle<T> object, GetOrCreateDataFlags flags = {}) {
622 ObjectData* data = broker->TryGetOrCreateData(object, flags);
623 if (data == nullptr) {
624 DCHECK_EQ(flags & kCrashOnError, 0);
625 TRACE_BROKER_MISSING(broker, "ObjectData for " << Brief(*object));
626 }
627 return TryMakeRef<T>(broker, data);
628}
629
630template <class T, typename = std::enable_if_t<is_subtype_v<T, Object>>>
631typename ref_traits<T>::ref_type MakeRef(JSHeapBroker* broker,
632 Tagged<T> object) {
633 return TryMakeRef(broker, object, kCrashOnError).value();
634}
635
636template <class T, typename = std::enable_if_t<is_subtype_v<T, Object>>>
637typename ref_traits<T>::ref_type MakeRef(JSHeapBroker* broker, T object) {
638 static_assert(kTaggedCanConvertToRawObjects);
639 return TryMakeRef(broker, Tagged<T>(object), kCrashOnError).value();
640}
641
642template <class T, typename = std::enable_if_t<is_subtype_v<T, Object>>>
643typename ref_traits<T>::ref_type MakeRef(JSHeapBroker* broker,
644 Handle<T> object) {
645 return TryMakeRef(broker, object, kCrashOnError).value();
646}
647
648template <class T, typename = std::enable_if_t<is_subtype_v<T, Object>>>
649typename ref_traits<T>::ref_type MakeRefAssumeMemoryFence(JSHeapBroker* broker,
650 Tagged<T> object) {
651 return TryMakeRef(broker, object, kAssumeMemoryFence | kCrashOnError).value();
652}
653
654template <class T, typename = std::enable_if_t<is_subtype_v<T, Object>>>
655typename ref_traits<T>::ref_type MakeRefAssumeMemoryFence(JSHeapBroker* broker,
656 T object) {
657 static_assert(kTaggedCanConvertToRawObjects);
658 return TryMakeRef(broker, object, kAssumeMemoryFence | kCrashOnError).value();
659}
660
661template <class T, typename = std::enable_if_t<is_subtype_v<T, Object>>>
662typename ref_traits<T>::ref_type MakeRefAssumeMemoryFence(JSHeapBroker* broker,
663 Handle<T> object) {
664 return TryMakeRef(broker, object, kAssumeMemoryFence | kCrashOnError).value();
665}
666
667#define V(Type, name, Name) \
668 inline typename ref_traits<Type>::ref_type JSHeapBroker::name() { \
669 if (!name##_) { \
670 Init##Name(); \
671 } \
672 return name##_.value(); \
673 }
674READ_ONLY_ROOT_LIST(V)
675#undef V
676
677} // namespace compiler
678} // namespace internal
679} // namespace v8

681#endif // V8_COMPILER_JS_HEAP_BROKER_H_
